item.title: England start World Cup against Croatia, Scotland to face Brazil
item.description: England will begin their World Cup 2026 campaign against Croatia, while Scotland have been drawn in the same group as Brazil for next summer's tournament.

item.title: Plotting England and Scotland's routes through the World Cup
item.description: It took a while, but the World Cup draw is finally done and fans of England and Scotland can start to work out their path to glory.

item.title: Haaland v Mbappe, dream ties and YMCA - the best of the World Cup draw
item.description: YMCA, Donald Trump and Kylian Mbappe v Erling Haaland - BBC Sport runs through the best bits from the World Cup draw.

item.title: Old and new foes - a look at England's World Cup group
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Croatia, Panama and Ghana - England's Group L opponents at the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: Who are favourites to win the 2026 World Cup?
item.description: The 2026 World Cup draw has been made which means the countdown to the tournament is on - but who are the favourites to win the coveted trophy?

item.title: Could one win get Scotland out of World Cup group?
item.description: BBC Scotland digs into Scotland's World Cup progression prospects.

item.title: President Trump wins inaugural Fifa Peace Prize
item.description: US President Donald Trump receives the inaugural Fifa Peace Prize before the draw for the 2026 Fifa World Cup.

item.title: 'Buzzing' Scots have 'point to prove' at World Cup
item.description: Current and former Scotland players react to the 2026 World Cup draw, with an air of cautious optimism.

item.title: Kind draw with an edge? Wales' potential World Cup group
item.description: If Wales qualify for the World Cup, they will be pleased with a relatively kind draw - and a chance to settle a score with co-hosts Canada.

item.title: 'Bring it on' says Clarke as Scotland face Brazil, Morocco & Haiti
item.description: Scotland will open their World Cup finals next summer against Haiti after also being drawn against Brazil and Morocco.

item.title: 'Fearless' Northern Ireland learn potential World Cup rivals
item.description: Northern Ireland will face hosts Canada, Qatar and Switzerland in Group B of the World Cup if they come through March's tricky play-off.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v DJ and producer Paige Tomlinson
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on DJ Paige Tomlinson - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Man City won't take risk on 'suffering' Rodri's return
item.description: Manchester City midfielder Rodri is "suffering" and "struggling" as he wants to make a return to action from a hamstring injury, says manager Pep Guardiola.

item.title: Eckert, 32, gets Southampton job and eyes Premier League
item.description: Tonda Eckert targets a promotion challenge after being appointed Southampton's permanent boss on a contract to 2027.

item.title: Republic of Ireland learn potential World Cup opponents
item.description: The Republic of Ireland will face hosts Mexico, South Africa and South Korea in Group A in the World Cup if they come through March's play-offs.

item.title: Mainoo in demand for January loan - Saturday's gossip
item.description: At least 12 clubs want Kobbie Mainoo on loan, Nottingham Forest set to increase Elliot Anderson price, Saudi clubs confident of cut-price Mohamed Salah deal, plus more.

item.title: Tuchel reacts to England's 'difficult' World Cup group
item.description: World Cup 2026: Thomas Tuchel reacts to England's 'difficult' group after draw

item.title: 'Bring it on' - Clarke reacts to Scotland's World Cup draw
item.description: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke reacts to being drawn into Group C for the 2026 World Cup alongside Brazil, Morocco and Haiti.

item.title: When England thrashed Panama at 2018 World Cup in Russia
item.description: BBC Sport looks back at England's 6-1 win over Panama in 2018, after the two sides are drawn in the same group for the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: Borini scores as Salford shock Leyton Orient in FA Cup
item.description: Former Liverpool and Italy forward Fabio Borini scores for Salford City as they beat Leyton Orient 4-0 to reach the third round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Unlucky own goal helps Gladbach beat Mainz
item.description: Watch highlights, as the Bundesliga's bottom side Mainz 05 suffer a narrow defeat to Borussia Monchengladbach.

item.title: Arsenal's Mosquera could be out for at least six weeks
item.description: Arsenal fear Cristhian Mosquera will miss at least six weeks, with the defender set to undergo further tests to establish the full extent of his ankle injury.

item.title: Mejbri given four-game ban for spitting at fans
item.description: Burnley midfielder Hannibal Mejbri is given a four-match ban and a £15,000 fine after spitting at Leeds United fans last month.

item.title: When will England and Scotland find out where they will play World Cup matches?
item.description: England and Scotland will know their World Cup opponents on Friday, but there will be a wait to discover where they will play.

item.title: Morecambe takeover figure accused of terrorism involvement
item.description: A key figure behind the Morecambe FC takeover deal is sanctioned by the UK government over accusations of involvement in terrorism.

item.title: 'A wonderful miracle' - how Messi & Beckham made Miami shine
item.description: In the world of team sport, no-one adores the achievements of its most accomplished individuals more than America's sports-mad fans, writes Guillem Balague.

item.title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
item.description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

item.title: All your FPL stats and Premier League team news in one place
item.description: Every key bit of Premier League team news and the most important Fantasy Premier League statistics - all in one place.

item.title: Amorim defends his use of midfielder Mainoo
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim defends his failure to start any academy player in the Premier League this season and repeated his reasons for not giving Kobbie Mainoo an opportunity.

item.title: Who are the 2026 World Cup debutants?
item.description: From a tiny Caribbean island to a nation once managed by Harry Redknapp, meet the teams who will be making their debut at the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: Littlejohn given extended ban for violent conduct
item.description: Crystal Palace midfielder Ruesha Littlejohn has been given an extended five-match ban for violent conduct after grabbing an opponent by the neck and throwing her to the ground.

item.title: 'Always in my mind to start' - Slot on Salah
item.description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot says Mohamed Salah is 'always in my mind to start' after the Egypt forward was left out of the last two starting line-ups.

item.title: Fenerbahce captain's home raided in Turkish betting scandal
item.description: Players, club directors, a commentator and a referee are among the latest to be arrested in Turkey's betting scandal.

item.title: Man Utd halted as Magassa gets first West Ham goal
item.description: Watch Premier League highlights as Manchester United are held at home by West Ham, with Soungoutou Magassa scoring his first Hammers goal.

item.title: Leeds stun Chelsea to end four-game losing streak
item.description: Struggling Leeds end a four-game losing run to dent Chelsea's Premier League title charge with a stunning 3-1 win at Elland Road.

item.title: Mukiele own goal hands Liverpool draw with Sunderland
item.description: Florian Wirtz's shot takes a deflection off of Nordi Mukiele to earn Liverpool a hard-won point against Sunderland

item.title: Arsenal extend unbeaten run with victory over Brentford
item.description: Mikel Merino and Bukayo Saka score as Arsenal beat Brentford to restore their five-point lead at the top of the Premier League table.

item.title: Villa come from behind to beat Brighton in seven-goal thriller
item.description: Ollie Watkins scores twice to pull his team back from two goals behind as Aston Villa go on to defeat Brighton 4-3.

item.title: Forest claim three points as Wolves' winless run continues
item.description: Igor Jesus' first Premier League goal condemns winless Wolves to another defeat as Nottingham Forest edge a poor game at Molineux.

item.title: Munoz scores as Palace edge past Burnley for win
item.description: Daniel Munoz scores the only goal as Crystal Palace climb to fifth in the Premier League with victory against Burnley.

item.title: How to follow the FA Cup on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the FA Cup second round on TV and radio this weekend.

item.title: Time to take a punt on Wirtz - FPL team of the week
item.description: Phil Foden is the hottest midfield asset in the game at the moment, with four goals in two games, and it seems daft not to sign him if you have the money.

item.title: Man Utd will look to sign cover for pregnant Bizet
item.description: Manchester United manager Marc Skinner has said the club will look to sign cover for midfielder Celin Bizet in January after she announced her pregnancy.

item.title: Rangers' title hopes distant 'but not impossible'
item.description: Rangers' route to Scottish Premiership title success "is a long way but it's not impossible", says head coach Danny Rohl.

item.title: Trump and Infantino - too close for comfort?
item.description: Friday’s World Cup draw in Washington DC will be the latest illustration of the ever-closer relationship between US President Donald Trump and Fifa president Gianni Infantino.

item.title: Quiz: Which nations have qualified for 2026 World Cup?
item.description: We want you to name every nation who has qualified for the 2026 World Cup.

item.title: Newcastle have money to spend in January - Wilson
item.description: Newcastle United have money to spend in January - but sporting director Ross Wilson says any mid-season moves will have to "align" with their summer plan.

item.title: Trump receives inaugural Fifa Peace Prize
item.description: Watch the moment US president receives the first ever Fifa Peace Prize at the 2026 World Cup draw.

item.title: Hasselhoff, Clinton & Blatter v Williams - the 1994 World Cup draw
item.description: Watch the last USA World Cup draw that was Las Vegas in 1994 featuring famous faces like Robin Williams, Bill Clinton and more.

item.title: Heat will reduce intensity of matches - Tuchel
item.description: England manager Thomas Tuchel speaks to BBC sports editor Dan Roan about how high temperatures could impact the World Cup next summer.

item.title: Haaland's journey to 100 Premier League goals
item.description: As Erling Haaland becomes the fastest player to score 100 goals in the Premier League, BBC Sport looks back at the Norway striker's best moments for Man City.

item.title: Five things to look out for in EFL: Promotion pushes past and present
item.description: BBC Sport highlights five things to keep an eye on in the EFL this weekend, including Derby v Leicester and Ipswich v Coventry.

item.title: History and upsets - five things to watch for in FA Cup
item.description: With history up for grabs and upsets on the cards, here are the five things to watch out for in the FA Cup second round.

item.title: Paqueta to make immediate return after ban
item.description: West Ham boss Nuno Espirito Santo says Lucas Paqueta will start Sunday's Premier League game at Brighton after serving a one-match ban.

item.title: When is the FA Cup third round draw?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at the details of the FA Cup third round draw

item.title: 'The time was right' - Oxtoby swaps Northern Ireland for Newcastle
item.description: Stepping away from international football to manage a club in England's second tier was a decision Tanya Oxtoby "didn't take lightly".

item.title: How England use artificial intelligence to help with penalties
item.description: How do England use artificial intelligence to prepare for penalty shootouts? Rhys Long, the FA's head of performance insights and analysis, explains all.

item.title: 'We lost control' - Amorim rues late West Ham leveller
item.description: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim bemoans his side's inability to hold on to a lead, after drawing 1-1 with West Ham United.

item.title: Old Trafford draw 'another step' forward for West Ham - Nuno
item.description: West Ham manager Nuno Espirito Santo is pleased with his team's work, after the Hammers came from a goal down to draw 1-1 away to Manchester United.

item.title: Arsenal squad depth is 'remarkable' - analysis
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy is impressed with the strength and depth of the Arsenal squad as the changes they made, particularly down the right side, paid off against Brentford.

item.title: How Farke stumbled on new system to get Leeds playing again
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Shay Given look at Leeds boss Daniel Farke "stumbled" on a new system and how it worked in their favour in their 3-1 win over Chelsea.

item.title: Newcastle want to be 'top club in world' by 2030
item.description: Newcastle United "in the debate about being the top club in the world" according to new CEO David Hopkinson.

item.title: Can anyone stop Lampard's Coventry winning the Championship?
item.description: Frank Lampard's Coventry City are 10 points clear at the top of the Championship and could create history - but will anything stand in their way?

item.title: Woeful Wolves on course for lowest Christmas points tally
item.description: Wolves' winless start to the season means they are on course for some unwanted records - including equalling the Premier League's lowest Christmas points tally.

item.title: Success in 2025 - are the Lionesses ready for 2026?
item.description: England capped off a successful 2025 with resounding victories over China and Ghana at home - so what shape are they in for World Cup qualification?

item.title: Racism, rape and death threats: One weekend of social media abuse in football
item.description: More than 2,000 extremely abusive social media posts were sent about managers and players in the Premier League and Women's Super League in a single weekend, a BBC investigation finds.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Which team won the fewest points in a Premier League season?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at which clubs amassed the lowest points tally in a single season.

item.title: What is the dubious goals committee?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains what the dubious goals committee is and how the identities of goal scorers are decided

item.title: Why is Son Heung-min returning to Tottenham?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why former captain Son Heung-min is returning to Tottenham.

item.title: When are Premier League players heading to Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains when players will meet up with their countries at the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: What leagues have a winter break and when are they?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore which leagues will have a winter break in football.

item.title: Nancy takes bow against Hearts, Maswanhise & Rohl in focus
item.description: Wilfried Nancy takes charge of Celtic for the first time in their top-of-the-table meeting with Hearts - just one of the talking points over the weekend in the Scottish Premiership

item.title: Celtic 'need to believe in themselves more' - Nancy
item.description: Wilfried Nancy believes he has inherited a "quality team" at Celtic that needs "to believe a little bit more in themselves".

item.title: Rangers target minimum of three January signings - gossip
item.description: Rangers are on the hunt for a striker as Celtic are encouraged to explore the North American market...

item.title: Queen of the South's 18-month search for new board
item.description: The directors of Queen of the South announced their intention to stand down more than 18 months ago.

item.title: What's on Nancy's Celtic to-do list?
item.description: Wilfried Nancy has completed his long-waited move from Columbus Crew to Celtic, but what will be the new manager's priorities in Glasgow?

item.title: How Viking ended 34-year Norwegian title drought
item.description: Viking FK wrap up their first Norwegian league title in 34 years, sparking big celebrations in the city of Stavanger. BBC Sport takes a look at their achievement.

item.title: Ajax criticise 'outrageous' fireworks after match abandoned
item.description: Ajax criticise the "utterly outrageous" firework display which resulted in their Dutch league match against Groningen being abandoned.

item.title: What's going on with fan disorder at European games?
item.description: Was the disorder of Young Boys fans at Aston Villa an isolated incident, or does it indicate something more prevalent?

item.title: Arroyo proud of Kendall's 'amazing' first England goal
item.description: Aston Villa manager Natalia Arroyo says she has watched the "amazing moment" of Lucia Kendall's first England goal multiple times in recent days.

item.title: Meet the Gurkha's daughter making WSL history
item.description: Asmita Ale discusses her incredible family history, being the first person of Nepalese descent to sign a professional contract in England and play in the Women's Super League.

item.title: Germany to host Euro 2029 as England chase trophy hat-trick
item.description: Germany will host the 2029 Women's European Championship, Uefa announces.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
